ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] [OT] Fascinating Article
ygData.msgSnippet: That was the link!   Thanks. So how did I (and other women) get interested in EQ if the marketting is all geared toward men?  Desire to *be* Firiona?  No way.
ygData.messageBody:
That was the link! Thanks.

So how did I (and other women) get interested in EQ if the marketting is
all geared toward men? Desire to *be* Firiona? No way. Everyone's
different, but I can't imagine most women would be drawn to her. Think
about the covers of the four boxes. On three of them, Firiona's not even
doing anything. If she were in my group I'd say "Quit standing around,
[explative], and come help us! We've got a battle going on here!" The
one cover she's not just standing around on she's chained up. Great! Just
the person I'd want to play with! Doesn't help the group at all and then
goes and gets herself into trouble and needs to be rescued. Gah! Leave to
the lizard!

Course, that bard on the first box wasn't much better. She was probably
singing, yes, but empty handed? Play or fight, sister!

Or am I starting to need a life more than David Kennerly?

:-)

Evulia,
a bubble from a surname,
Tunare





"Talies the
Wanderer" To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
<snicker@pink cc:
pig.com> Subject: Re: [eqbards] [OT] Fascinating Article

02/15/2002
09:58 AM
Please
respond to
eqbards






At 09:53 AM 2/15/2002 -0500, you wrote:
>It funny, but I was just reading a statistical analysis of the EQ player
>base and it claimed female players enjoy EQ more than male players.
>Something to do with women exploiting the social aspects of the game where
>men just powerlevel and get phat lewtz. Buggered if I can find that link
>now though, sorry. It was the same sort of stereotypical stuff as listed
>below.

That link was actually used as fodder for this article, and was cited:

http://www.nickyee.com/eqt/report.html


Talies the Wanderer
